title: Hayward Universal H-Series Digital (HFDN) — Error Codes
description: Reference list of diagnostic error codes for Hayward Universal H-Series Digital gas heaters (FDN/HFDN models with LCD display). Includes common causes, fixes, and direct flow links for guided troubleshooting.

errors.title: Blower Vacuum Switch Open
errors.meaning: Blower vacuum switch is open when it should be closed during blower operation.
errors.fix: Check blower start-up, vacuum hose for blockage, and switch continuity (should read closed when blower is running). Replace switch if open.

errors.title: Blower Vacuum Switch Closed
errors.meaning: Blower vacuum switch detected closed when blower is off.
errors.fix: Verify switch opens when blower is off. If not, switch may be shorted or stuck closed. Replace blower vacuum switch if necessary.

errors.title: Ignition Failure
errors.meaning: Ignition sequence failed — flame not detected after ignition attempt.
errors.fix: Check 120 VAC to igniter during startup, verify gas supply and pressure, ensure flame sensor clean and in position. Replace ignition control if issue persists.

errors.title: High Limit or Overheat
errors.meaning: Heater detected excessive water temperature or open high-limit sensor.
errors.fix: Verify flow through system, clean filter, and inspect high-limit sensor for open condition below 135°F. Replace high-limit if open when cool.

errors.title: Water Pressure / Limit Fault
errors.meaning: Low water flow or open pressure switch detected.
errors.fix: Ensure pump is running, clean filter, verify pressure switch closes with pump on. Replace switch if no continuity under flow.

errors.title: Polarity / Voltage Fault
errors.meaning: Heater detected reversed line/neutral or low voltage supply.
errors.fix: Confirm correct wiring polarity and stable 110–130 VAC input. Verify ground connection to heater chassis.

errors.title: Communication Error
errors.meaning: Display and main control board communication failure.
errors.fix: Inspect and reseat ribbon cable between display and control board. Clean corrosion and check connector pins. Replace display if persistent.

errors.title: Bad Control Board
errors.meaning: Main control board has failed or internal memory error detected.
errors.fix: Cycle power. If fault returns immediately, replace main control board.

errors.title: Flame Present without Gas
errors.meaning: Flame signal detected while gas valve not energized.
errors.fix: Check flame sense wire for short to ground. Verify gas valve is not leaking or stuck open. Replace valve if necessary.

errors.title: Sensor Failure
errors.meaning: Temperature sensor (thermistor) input out of range or open circuit.
errors.fix: Measure resistance of inlet/outlet sensors (77°F ≈ 10 kΩ, 104°F ≈ 6 kΩ). Replace faulty sensor.
